thread.title: Helloworld Instagram relay photos of Australia
thread.title_full: Helloworld Instagram relay photos of Australia

author: Rowena Ryan
title: Helloworld Instagram relay photos of Australia
text:
The Cape Byron Lighthouse, Byron Bay. Picture: Sera Wright.
Rowena Ryan Escape WHEN some of Australia’s best photographers came together for Helloworld’s Instagram relay on World Tourism Day, they captured Australia like never seen before.
The Helloworld relay covered over 60 countries and 80 destinations worldwide to showcase the incredible beauty and diversity of our planet. The photographers had just one day to capture their best shots facing unpredictable weather and the challenges of distance.
In Sydney, Will Patino battled dark skies which made for dramatic shots of the iconic Bondi Icebergs.
The moody Icebergs at Bondi Beach. Picture: Will Patino.
A different kind of image of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Picture: Will Patino.
In QLD, Reichlyn Aguilar used the sun to play up the colours of the pool water at One & Only Hayman Island.
The stunning colours of Hayman Island. Picture: Reichlyn Aguilar.
Scott Connell covered a huge amount of ground in Western Australia starting at the Kununurra and finishing at Broome.
The reddest of Earths at Gantheaume Point, Western Australia. Picture: Scott Connell.
Cable Beach, Broome. Picture: Scott Connell.
Paul Fleming captured the sunrise shot at Mount Wellington and the sunset shot at Coles Bay. The sun rises and sets at a slower pace in Tasmania so the colours tend to linger longer.
Mount Wellington sunrise. Picture: Paul Fleming.
Russell Falls, Mt Field National Park, Tasmania. Picture: Paul Fleming.
The Australian landscape and famous spots were captured in varying ways and lights, including a mobile instameet on a double decker bus in Hobart and an instameet at sea on stand up paddleboards in Lord Howe Island.
Stunning Lord Howe Island. Picture: Jewels Lynch.
Yellow Water Billabong, Kakadu, Northern Territory. Picture: @paularnoldphotography.
Magical sunset at Port Douglas. Picture: Alyssa Giannoni.
Vlassoff Cay, Cairns. Picture: Alyssa Giannoni.
Flinders Street Station, Melbourne. Picture: AAT Kings.
Handorf, South Australia. Picture: Bonnie Hamilton.
Penfold’s Magill Estate, South Australia. Picture: Duy Huynh.
Originally published as Amazing photos of Australia Jump back to top
